glsa.title: LMBench: Insecure temporary file usage
glsa.synopsis: Multiple insecure temporary file usage issues have been reported in LMBench, allowing for symlink attacks.

background.p: LMBench is a suite of simple, portable benchmarks for UNIX platforms.

description.p: Dmitry E. Oboukhov reported that the rccs and STUFF scripts do not handle "/tmp/sdiff.#####" temporary files securely. NOTE: There might be further occurances of insecure temporary file usage.

impact.p: A local attacker could perform symlink attacks to overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: LMBench has been removed from Portage. We recommend that users unmerge LMBench:
